Key Match Events: Zack Kelly allowed five runs in the top of the ninth, including a leadoff single, a strikeout, and then let the next five men reach safely.
Pre-Game Insights: If the Red Sox wanted to give themselves any realistic shot at making the playoffs, they had to take care of business this weekend against the woeful Chicago White Sox.
Post-Match Reflections: Alex Cora said, 'We had a chance. It was a tie game in the ninth, we just didn't finish that inning.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Richard Fitts enjoyed a standout showing in his MLB debut, pitching into the sixth inning and allowing two unearned runs on six hits and a walk with two strikeouts over 5.2 innings.

The first inning wasn't exactly a glorious display of baserunning, with Jarren Duran being out by a mile at home after he was sent on a double down the right field line by Wilyer Abreu, and Abreu was caught between second and third for the final out of the inning.
Boston took the lead in the second when Connor Wong hit a solo shot for his 13th home run of the season.
The Red Sox are now one game over.500 at 72-71 with 19 games to play.
